titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Robert D. Farquhar architectural drawings, 1920-1940 LSC.1579
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Caroline Cubé, 2005.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-10 13:42:05 -0700.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert D. Farquhar architectural drawings (Collection 1579). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of architectural drawings, blueprints, sketches, and plans of Robert D. Farquhar, and one photograph of Bourgeois, Arthur Brown's collaborator for the San Francisco Hall. Includes drawings for Florence Brown residence in Bel Air (Los Angeles), Mrs. Henry Weyse residence in Santa Monica, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Quinn residence in Holmby Hills (Los Angeles), and the Harvey Mudd and Richard Rogers residence in Beverly Hills.

altformavail.head: Online Items Available
altformavail.p: Portions of this collection have been digitized and are available online: Robert D. Farquhar Architectural Drawings (8 items).

did.unittitle: Ellis [?] Jones residence, L.S. - sketches and floor plans.
Mrs. Henry Weyse residence, Santa Monica - drawings.
House in perspective - RDF.
Mr. and Mrs. Charles Quinn residence, Holmby Hills.
W.L. Garland residence, little cocktail room drawings, blueprints.
Francis Farquhar residence and book cases - sketches and plans.
Titcomb - miscellaneous sketches.
Mr. and Mrs. Ben Stroud residence, Huntington Palisades, Santa Monica.
Titcomb's drawings for California Club and sketches for living room.
381 California Terrace, Pasadena. Roland Coates, architect, bought by RDF 1929, sold 1950.
Quinn house, 1936, porch addition, west porch - prints. Quality sheet metal.
Miss T.H. Graham residence, Sierra Madre - drawings.
Greek church[?].
Colin Farquhar: Hunter's Creek - mill house. Colin's Mill house.
Mrs. Quinn's collection - urns, vases, etc.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: "Not done, too costly for heirs, about $10,000 for cases. Gift to USC. USC room Mrs. Quinn's pottery."

did.unittitle: Danziger residence, Los Angeles - cloth blue prints.
Pembery drawings from England for Quinn Room, Huntington Library - drawings and blue prints. 4 rolls.
Harvey Mudd residence, Beverly Hills - drawings for mantel.
Treanor - front door.
Studio - Browning Building, Waco University.
Mrs. Fudger.
